data.title: Just a sandwich
data.text: That's all I wanted. We were just passing through Chattanooga and saw this place. We parked across the street and went in. We ordered what turned out to be (almost) Subway quality subs. Too much bread and lettuce. I ended up moving the filling from one half and adding it to the other half. That improved things somewhat. My sandwich was supposed to have guacamole on it. I had a hard time detecting it in there. This place is noisy! We should have taken our food to go and eaten elsewhere. The only thing going for this deli is speed. We have delis here in Delaware with real subs.

data.title: Rude
data.text: Rude staff on phone when calling in order, did not listen, heard clerk tell other staff he was going to hang up on me while I was trying to verify a colleagues order. Food is so so subs-maybe when Northshore locAtion opens they will do customer service training. We have way better sandwich shops in town- go to River City deli instead

data.title: Passing through for a quick bite
data.text:
Happy to see a JJ on on way home from vacation.  Saw the JJ was close to the interstate and was hoping to grab a quick bite.   Six of us were eating , we ordered a slim and one without tomatoes and they messed them both up.  The other four they got right, #4's, pretty easy to get right.   
Music was obnoxiously loud, three tables were dirty with no one else in restaurant, with four workers behind counter.   
Not up to usual standards.

data.title: pretty good
data.text: the gargantuan is the only thing on the menu that is worth it. Everything else is lacking. The staff is friendly though.

data.title: Cold, Loud, Don't order tuna salad
data.text: Should you eat here,  plan to go sit in the park across the street to eat.   The music is too loud and people shouting over it.   I ordered tuna salad sandwich with no onions.  They warned me the onion was already mixed in, but naturally I expected that to be as an accent to the tuna.   What I got was a sandwich with way too much  extremely strong onion with the tuna sort of an afterthought.    I had heartburn all afternoon and would not have eaten it except I was hungry by then.   To be fair, my husband did like his turkey sandwich.   Unless you want an onion sandwich, don't order the tuna salad.

data.title: So convenient for working downtown.
data.text: Great sandwich and they always get my order right.  And they are so quick!  Always a good standby when we are busy.

data.title: An overachiever
data.text: Delivery, good sandwich, decent price, what's not to like? There are better delis in town, but the delivery really helps during a work filled day. Definitely prefer the wheat bread  to the white sub.

data.title: Consist in taste
data.text: Great customer service and each sandwich always taste great and fresh!  No matter what you order expect it to taste good.

data.title: True to their company!
data.text: Jimmy Johns prides itself in being 'freaky fast', and they really are. I order from this Jimmy Johns all the time and I've never been disappointed. Their food is always fresh and exactly as I order it -- it gets delivered to me faster than any pizza joint has. I will continue ordering for quite a time to come.

data.title: Delicious but weird staff
data.text: The sandwiches (no2 and 10) were delicious and I can see why my partner eats them a lot. However, the staff were weird and we were made to feel very awkward by the staff who just stared at us and seemed incapabke of asking questions. The ordeal was so bizarre we started to question if there was some sort of robbery going on and the staff were mot staff at all. My partner felt the need to apologise to me on their behalf and explain it is never normally like that. Really weird.

data.title: Great choice, quick meal
data.text: Needed a quick meal as we had scheduled an event.  Remembered Jimmy Johns and stopped in.  Staff was helpful and food quality was excellent..  Very convenient and enjoyable meal.

data.title: Fast Option, Good Food
data.text: JJ's has a good selection of sub sandwiches.Their on-line menu is very easy to use, especially if you have personal preferences in the deign of your sandwich, Their ticket time is very good, and they have runners that will delivery in most downtown areas.

data.title: DELIVERY!
data.text: GREAT PLACE AND THEY DELIVER!! Working down town has it's advantages, and Jimmy John's is one of them. I've ordered online before and received my order in the next 10 mins. Freaky fast is an understatement.

data.title: Large Order
data.text: Called restaurant and ordered 40 box sandwiches. Was starting a lacrosse game and wanted to feed the team after before heading back home.   Order went smooth, manager was pleasant but wouldn't budge on delivery.  You see add after add about deliveries but we were one mile outside the 2 mile zone.  I asked him could he make an exception and he said he probably shouldn't even for such a large order.  I understand the rules but the manager should have flexibility in judgement.  Boxes were prepared well

data.title: Always a great place to eat no matter where you are.
data.text: I'm very picky about where I eat when I'm traveling for business.  I don't eat fast food and I don't want to go to a sit down restaurant and eat by myself.  I like to just grab a sandwich and head back to my room.  I ate here twice the week I was in town.  Both times my #9 was awesome!  Fresh, Fast, Friendly service also.  Thanks for a great meal!

data.title: Incomparable speed, value, and fresh
data.text: This is such a convenient place to stop by when in downtown Chattanooga. The sandwiches are of high quality as well and oh so fresh. Also their service is impeccable to the point that I would believe that they are mind readers. It is almost as if it is ready to be handed to you as you walk in the door. The sub sandwich with cookie is a great deal and treat for the out of town traveler.

data.title: Slow. Expensive. Cold. Surly.
data.text: Please refer to title, and you just about have it all. The place is all hype and not enough substance. Compared to other sandwich chains, it's not even worth a look. Worse, the staff are completely unapologetic. Try Firehouse or Lenny's instead and save yourself some trouble.

data.title: FREAKY FAST LUNCH
data.text: Indeed they are freaky fast when it comes to service whether you eat in, take out of deliver!  The staff is very attentive and always extend a big welcome.  Tasty sandwiches

data.title: Quick stop quick food
data.text: It was okay, not as good as others in Georgia or Minnesota. The staff was rushed and acted it, the order was messed up and didn't seem to care. Requested bread wasn't used and told too busy to remake. Will not eat there again. Food was ok but attitude was over riding factor.

data.title: Freah, Fast, Tasty
data.text: While attending a three-day meeting at the Chattanooga Convention Center, I saw a runner from Jimmy John’s pass me in the hallway, making a delivery. I Googled Jimmy John’s and found it was just two blocks away. I had had only one prior experience with Jimmy John’s, in Savannah, and was hoping to find this one equally good. It was, and more so. I ordered my sandwich with some special conditions: double meat-and-cheese, no mayo, no mustard but extra oil and vinegar. The cashier was handing me my change and at the same time the counter man was handing me a wrapped sandwich. When I looked at him quizzically, he smiled and said, “Double meat and cheese, extra oil and vinegar – no mustard or mayo!” the bread is baked right there, the meats and veggies are fresh as well. It was so good, when our meeting was over the next day, we went back and had the same lunch again. Jimmy John’s is a great decision for a fresh, fast and tasty sandwich. I will always look for a Jimmy John’s when traveling from now on, and if I ever give up the practice of law, I may go on the road for Jimmy John’s!
